objects.name: Software Packing
objects.description: This code characteristic - Software Packing - can make static and behavioral analysis difficult and includes packing with software protectors, such as Themida and Armadillo [[1]](#1). Methods related to anti-analysis are below.

external_references.description: Jiang Ming et al, Towards Paving the Way for Large-Scale Windows Malware Analysis: Generic Binary Unpacking with Orders-of-Magnitude Performance Boost, October 2018,

x_mitre_methods.definition: the malware is packed by one packer, the result is packed, etc.
x_mitre_methods.name: Nested Packing

x_mitre_methods.definition: Uses a standard algorithm, such as UPX or LZMA, to compress an executable file.
x_mitre_methods.name: Standard Compression

x_mitre_methods.definition: Uses a standard algorithm to compress the opcode mnemonics.
x_mitre_methods.name: Standard Compression of Code

x_mitre_methods.definition: Uses a standard algorithm to compress strings and variables (executable file data).
x_mitre_methods.name: Standard Compression of Data

x_mitre_methods.definition: Uses a custom algorithm to compress an executable file.
x_mitre_methods.name: Custom Compression

x_mitre_methods.definition: Uses a custom algorithm to compress opcode mnemonics.
x_mitre_methods.name: Custom Compression of Code

x_mitre_methods.definition: Uses a custom algorithm to compress strings and variables (executable file data).
x_mitre_methods.name: Custom Compression of Data
